nachos

Class Options.Spec

  • java.lang.Object
    • nachos.Options.Spec
  • Enclosing class:
    Options

    public static class Options.Spec
extends java.lang.Object
    Class whose objects represent the specification of a particular type of option to look for in the argument list.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Options.Action action
      Action to take when an instance of the option is encountered.
      private java.lang.String flag
      Flag that signals the start of the option.
      private java.lang.Class<?>[] types
      Specification of the number and types of the parameters.
      private java.lang.String usage
      Message to print if the proper number of parameters is not found.

      Method that checks whether an option flag matches this specification, and if so, collects and validates option parameters and dispatches the processing of this option.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spec

        public Spec(java.lang.String flag,
            java.lang.Class<?>[] types,
            java.lang.String usage,
            Options.Action action)
        Initialize a new option Spec.
        Parameters:
        flag - The flag that signals the start of the option. This can be any string, but conventionally option flags start with "-".
        types - Array of Class objects that specifies the number and types of the parameters that should follow this option flag.
        usage - Message to be printed when the proper number or types of parameters are not found for an option, or null for no useful message.
        action - Action to be taken when an occurrence of this option and its associated parameters is encountered in the argument list.

    • Method Detail

      • match

        public void match(java.lang.String flag,
                  java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> args)
        Method that checks whether an option flag matches this specification, and if so, collects and validates option parameters and dispatches the processing of this option.
        Parameters:
        flag - The option flag to match.
        args - Iterator that provides the remaining arguments. If the option flag matches this spec, then any parameters required will be obtained from this iterator.
